subject: Re: [junit] Execution Order
msgSnippet: ... There is no declared order. In fact the order is definitively stated to be undefined. This encourages tests to be written in such a way as to be
messageBody:
On 8/28/06, huaishih_wen <hwen@...> wrote:
> How does junit determine the order of execution for test methods?

There is no declared order. In fact the order is definitively stated
to be undefined. This encourages tests to be written in such a way as
to be independent of each other and execution sequence.

> How does junit determine the order of execution for test cases added
> to a test suite?

Don't know. I almost never use suites these days. The fine manual
might have an answer for that one. (as in Read The Fine Manula! ;-)

> Does junit execute test methods/test cases swquentially or
> concurrently?

Sequentially, although, given the independent nature of tests, there's
no reason why they shouldn't be executed in parallel. Mike Clark's
JUnitPerf goes half-way there and runs the same test in multiple
threads for performance reasons, but I don't know of any test runners
that run different tests in different threads. That'd be neat.

Simon

--
www.simonpeter.org
